entry.title: Updating or Modifying Payroll Results (Cluster Tables) in a Concurrent Employment Scenario
entry.content:
Why do we need to?

There are scenarios where payroll has already been executed, and subsequent activities such as posting to finance, bank transfers, or reporting have been carried out. Later, it may be discovered that certain employee-specific configurations were incorrect at the time of execution.

Although corrections may have been made in the configuration, the payroll engine may not reflect these updates. In some cases, it may even throw errors because the payroll results stored in the system do not align with the corrected configuration.

This creates a challenging situation:

  • We cannot simply delete the payroll results for an employee, as downstream processes (such as postings and payments) have already taken place.

  • At the same time, we cannot proceed with future payroll runs, as the inconsistency between payroll results and updated configuration prevents smooth processing.

In such cases, the ability to overwrite, modify, or update payroll results becomes essential. This approach provides a controlled way to align payroll results with corrected data, ensuring both system integrity and continuity of payroll operations.

How is it done?

  1. Validate Pernr by checking if the Person assignment is there or not.
  2. For the given Pernr, read the payroll cluster directory
  3. Check if the payroll results are available for the given sequence number
  4. Create a reference access object to payroll results
  5. Get all active Pernrs (Employments) for the period being processed
  6. Update payroll results for all Pernr assignments

Why do we need to?

There are scenarios where payroll has already been executed, and subsequent activities such as posting to finance, bank transfers, or reporting have been carried out. Later, it may be discovered that certain employee-specific configurations were incorrect at the time of execution.

Although corrections may have been made in the configuration, the payroll engine may not reflect these updates. In some cases, it may even throw errors because the payroll results stored in the system do not align with the corrected configuration.

This creates a challenging situation:

  • We cannot simply delete the payroll results for an employee, as downstream processes (such as postings and payments) have already taken place.

  • At the same time, we cannot proceed with future payroll runs, as the inconsistency between payroll results and updated configuration prevents smooth processing.

In such cases, the ability to overwrite, modify, or update payroll results becomes essential. This approach provides a controlled way to align payroll results with corrected data, ensuring both system integrity and continuity of payroll operations.

Program (Code) - To Update the Tax Company Code for the US in Payroll clusters/results when Concurrent Employment is Active/Enabled


*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Report  ZHR_TAX_COMP_UPDATE_US_CE
*&
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&
*&
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
REPORT zhr_tax_comp_update_us_ce NO STANDARD PAGE HEADING.

*& Data type declaration
TYPES:
  BEGIN OF ts_log,
    person   TYPE pc261-person,
    persdata TYPE pc261-persdata,
    seqnr    TYPE pc261-seqnr,
    abkrs    TYPE pc261-abkrs,
    fpper    TYPE pc261-fpper,
    inper    TYPE pc261-inper,
    payty    TYPE pc261-payty,
    paydt    TYPE pc261-paydt,
    status   TYPE char4,
    descr    TYPE char120,
  END OF ts_log.

*& Data declaration
DATA:
  lt_rgdir                  TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF pc261,
  ls_rgdir                  TYPE pc261,
  ls_rgdir1                 TYPE pc261,
  lv_relid                  TYPE relid_pcl,
  lv_molga                  TYPE molga,
  lt_result                 TYPE h99_hr_pay_result_tab,
  lv_pernr                  TYPE pcce_pernr,
  lv_update                 TYPE boolean,
  lo_access                 TYPE REF TO cl_hr_pay_access,
  lo_person_result          TYPE REF TO cl_hr_pay_result_person,
  lo_payroll_result_us      TYPE REF TO cl_hr_pay_result_person_us,
  lo_pr_peras_international TYPE REF TO cl_hr_pay_result,
  lo_pr_peras               TYPE REF TO cl_hr_pay_result_us,
  lo_person                 TYPE REF TO cl_hrcce_person_reader,
  ls_log                    TYPE ts_log,
  lt_log                    TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ts_log,
  lt_fieldcat               TYPE slis_t_fieldcat_alv,
  ls_fieldcat               TYPE slis_fieldcat_alv,
  ls_layout                 TYPE slis_layout_alv,
  lv_person                 TYPE personid,
  lt_assignments            TYPE pccet_pernr_unsorted.

*& Field symbol declaration
FIELD-SYMBOLS:
  <fs_grouping>   TYPE pc2grouping,
  <fs_rt_person>  TYPE pc2rt_person,
  <fs_crt_person> TYPE pc2crt_person,
  <fs_bt_person>  TYPE pc2bt_person,
  <fs_tax>        TYPE pc22t,
  <fs_tcrt>       TYPE pc23h.

*& Selection screen
SELECTION-SCREEN: BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE text-001.
PARAMETERS:
  p_pernr TYPE p_pernr MATCHCODE OBJECT prem OBLIGATORY,
  s_txcmp TYPE t5utl-txcmp OBLIGATORY,
  t_txcmp TYPE t5utl-txcmp OBLIGATORY,
  p_seqnr TYPE pc261-seqnr OBLIGATORY,
  p_test  AS   CHECKBOX.
SELECTION-SCREEN: END OF BLOCK b1.

AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON p_pernr.
*& Validate Pernr by getting Person and all the Pernrs for the given Pernr
  FREE lo_person.
  lo_person = cl_hrcce_person_reader=>get_instance( ).
  IF lo_person IS BOUND.
    TRY.
*& Check Person assignment
        CALL METHOD lo_person->get_personid
          EXPORTING
            p_pernr    = p_pernr
          RECEIVING
            p_personid = lv_person.
      CATCH cx_hrpa_violated_assertion .
        MESSAGE 'Person assignment is missing for the given pernr' TYPE 'E'.
    ENDTRY.                            " TRY.
  ENDIF.                               " IF lo_person IS BOUND.

START-OF-SELECTION.
*& Read payroll cluster directory
  REFRESH lt_rgdir.
  CALL FUNCTION 'CU_READ_RGDIR'
    EXPORTING
      persnr          = p_pernr
    TABLES
      in_rgdir        = lt_rgdir
    EXCEPTIONS
      no_record_found = 1
      OTHERS          = 2.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
          WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
  ELSEIF lt_rgdir IS INITIAL.
    CLEAR ls_log.
    ls_log-persdata = p_pernr.
    ls_log-status = icon_red_light.
    CONCATENATE 'Payroll results are not available for Pernr' p_pernr
           INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
    ls_log-person = lv_person.
    ls_log-persdata = p_pernr.
    APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
  ENDIF.                               " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*& Check if the payroll results available for given sequence number
  READ TABLE lt_rgdir INTO ls_rgdir1 WITH KEY seqnr = p_seqnr.
  IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
*& Access to payroll results
    FREE lo_access.
    CREATE OBJECT lo_access.
*& Get all Pernrs
    CALL METHOD lo_access->get_participating_pernrs
      EXPORTING
        molga            = lv_molga
        pernr            = p_pernr
        period           = ls_rgdir1
      IMPORTING
        pernr_tab        = lt_assignments
      EXCEPTIONS
        no_entries_found = 1
        OTHERS           = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
            WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
    ENDIF.                             " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
  ELSE.
    CLEAR ls_log.
    ls_log-persdata = p_pernr.
    ls_log-status = icon_red_light.
    CONCATENATE 'Payroll results are not available for Pernr' p_pernr
                'Sequence number' p_seqnr INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
    ls_log-person = lv_person.
    ls_log-persdata = p_pernr.
    APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
  ENDIF.                               " IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
*& Update payroll results for all Pernr assignments
  CLEAR lv_pernr.
  LOOP AT lt_assignments INTO lv_pernr.
*& Read payroll cluster directory
    REFRESH lt_rgdir.
    CALL FUNCTION 'CU_READ_RGDIR'
      EXPORTING
        persnr          = lv_pernr
      TABLES
        in_rgdir        = lt_rgdir
      EXCEPTIONS
        no_record_found = 1
        OTHERS          = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
            WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
*& Check if RGDIR is empty
    ELSEIF lt_rgdir IS INITIAL.
      CLEAR ls_log.
      ls_log-persdata = lv_pernr.
      ls_log-status = icon_red_light.
      CONCATENATE 'Payroll results are not available for Pernr'
                  lv_pernr INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
      ls_log-person = lv_person.
      ls_log-persdata = lv_pernr.
      APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
    ENDIF.                             " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*& Access to payroll results
    FREE lo_access.
    CREATE OBJECT lo_access.
*& Read payroll cluster
    LOOP AT lt_rgdir INTO ls_rgdir WHERE abkrs EQ ls_rgdir1-abkrs
                                     AND inper EQ ls_rgdir1-inper.
*& Read payroll cluster id
      CLEAR: lv_relid, lv_molga.
      CALL FUNCTION 'PYXX_GET_RELID_FROM_PERNR'
        EXPORTING
          employee                    = lv_pernr
        IMPORTING
          relid                       = lv_relid
          molga                       = lv_molga
        EXCEPTIONS
          error_reading_infotype_0001 = 1
          error_reading_molga         = 2
          error_reading_relid         = 3
          OTHERS                      = 4.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
              WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
      ENDIF.                             " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*& Read payroll results for Person and Pernr
      IF lo_access IS BOUND.
        FREE lo_person_result.
        REFRESH  lt_result.
        CALL METHOD lo_access->read_result
          EXPORTING
            pernr                         = lv_pernr
            molga                         = lv_molga
            period                        = ls_rgdir
          IMPORTING
            pay_result_person             = lo_person_result
            pay_results                   = lt_result
          EXCEPTIONS
            no_authorization              = 1
            read_error                    = 2
            country_version_not_available = 3
            OTHERS                        = 4.
        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
          MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
                  WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
        ENDIF.                         " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*& Get Person payroll results
        FREE lo_payroll_result_us.
        IF lo_person_result IS BOUND.
          lo_payroll_result_us ?= lo_person_result.
        ENDIF.                         " IF lo_person_result IS BOUND.
*& Update Tax Company in Person payroll results
        IF lo_payroll_result_us IS BOUND.
*& Update the RT_PEROSN cluster with correct tax company code
          UNASSIGN <fs_rt_person>.
          LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-rt_person ASSIGNING <fs_rt_person>.
            IF <fs_rt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
              <fs_rt_person>-grouping_value = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF <fs_rt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
          ENDLOOP.                     " LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-rt_person...
*& Update the CRT_PEROSN cluster with correct tax company code
          UNASSIGN <fs_crt_person>.
          LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-crt_person ASSIGNING <fs_crt_person>.
            IF <fs_crt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
              <fs_crt_person>-grouping_value = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF <fs_crt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
          ENDLOOP.                     " LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-crt_person...
*& Update the BT_PEROSN cluster with correct tax company code
          UNASSIGN <fs_bt_person>.
          LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-bt_person ASSIGNING <fs_bt_person>.
            IF <fs_bt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
              <fs_bt_person>-grouping_value = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF <fs_bt_person>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
          ENDLOOP.                     " LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-bt_person...
*& Update the GROUPING cluster with correct tax company code
          UNASSIGN <fs_grouping>.
          LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-grouping ASSIGNING <fs_grouping> .
            IF <fs_grouping>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
              <fs_grouping>-grouping_value = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF <fs_grouping>-grouping_value EQ s_txcmp.
          ENDLOOP.                     " LOOP AT lo_payroll_result_us->inter-grouping...
*            ls_result-EVP = o_payroll_result_us->
*& Get Pernr details
          FREE lo_pr_peras.
          LOOP AT lt_result INTO lo_pr_peras_international.
            IF lo_pr_peras_international IS NOT INITIAL.
              lo_pr_peras ?= lo_pr_peras_international.
            ENDIF.                     " IF lo_pr_peras_international IS NOT INITIAL.
          ENDLOOP.                     " LOOP AT lt_result...
*& Update Tax Company in Pernr payroll results
          IF lo_pr_peras IS BOUND.
*& Update the TAX cluster with correct tax company code
            UNASSIGN <fs_tax>.
            LOOP AT lo_pr_peras->natio-tax ASSIGNING <fs_tax>.
              IF <fs_tax>-tccpm EQ s_txcmp.
                <fs_tax>-tccpm = t_txcmp.
                lv_update = abap_true.
              ENDIF.                   " IF <fs_tax>-tccpm EQ s_txcmp.
            ENDLOOP.                   " LOOP AT lo_pr_peras->natio-tax
*& Update the TCRT cluster with correct tax company code
            UNASSIGN <fs_tcrt>.
            LOOP AT lo_pr_peras->natio-tcrt ASSIGNING <fs_tcrt>.
              IF <fs_tcrt>-txcmp EQ s_txcmp.
                <fs_tcrt>-txcmp = t_txcmp.
                lv_update = abap_true.
              ENDIF.                   " IF <fs_tcrt>-txcmp EQ s_txcmp.
            ENDLOOP.                   " LOOP AT lo_pr_peras->natio-tcrt...
*& Update the PERM cluster with correct tax company code
            IF lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-tccpm EQ s_txcmp.
              lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-tccpm = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-tccpm
            IF lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-txcmp EQ s_txcmp.
              lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-txcmp = t_txcmp.
              lv_update = abap_true.
            ENDIF.                     " IF lo_pr_peras->natio-perm-txcmp...
          ENDIF.                       " IF lo_pr_peras IS BOUND.
*& Check if Tax Company to be updated to the DB
          IF lv_update EQ abap_true.
            IF p_test EQ abap_false.
*& Refresh buffer
              CALL METHOD lo_access->reset_buffer.
*& Write the changes to buffer
              CALL METHOD lo_access->write_result
                EXPORTING
                  pay_result_person = lo_person_result
                  pay_results       = lt_result
*                 SIM_NON_CE_RESULT = ' '
                EXCEPTIONS
                  no_authorization  = 1
                  write_error       = 2
                  inconsistent_data = 3
                  OTHERS            = 4.
              IF sy-subrc <> 0.
                MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
              ENDIF.                     " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
*& Push the chnages from buffer to the DB
              CALL METHOD lo_access->write_to_database
                EXCEPTIONS
                  no_authorization = 1
                  write_error      = 2
                  OTHERS           = 3.
              IF sy-subrc <> 0.
                MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
              ELSE.
                COMMIT WORK.
                CLEAR ls_log.
                MOVE-CORRESPONDING ls_rgdir TO ls_log.
                ls_log-status = icon_green_light.
                CONCATENATE 'Payroll results were updated from Tax Company' s_txcmp 'to'
                t_txcmp 'for Pernr' lv_pernr 'Perosn' lo_person_result->person
                INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
                APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
              ENDIF.                     " IF sy-subrc <> 0.
            ELSE.
              MOVE-CORRESPONDING ls_rgdir TO ls_log.
              ls_log-status = icon_green_light.
              CONCATENATE 'Payroll results were updated from Tax Company' s_txcmp 'to'
              t_txcmp 'for Pernr' lv_pernr 'Perosn' lo_person_result->person
              INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
              APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
            ENDIF.                   " IF P_test EQ abap_false.
          ELSE.
            CLEAR ls_log.
            MOVE-CORRESPONDING ls_rgdir TO ls_log.
            ls_log-status = icon_red_light.
            CONCATENATE 'Source Tax Company ' s_txcmp 'does not exists for Pernr '
                        lv_pernr 'Perosn ' lo_person_result->person INTO ls_log-descr SEPARATED BY space.
            APPEND ls_log TO lt_log.
          ENDIF.                       " IF lv_update EQ abap_true.
        ENDIF.                         " IF lo_payroll_result_us IS BOUND.
      ENDIF.                           " IF lo_access IS BOUND.
    ENDLOOP.                           " LOOP AT lt_rgdir
  ENDLOOP.                             " LOOP AT lt_assignments...

END-OF-SELECTION.
*& Build field catalog to display log
  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'PERSON'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'PERSON'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'PERSDATA'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'PERSDATA'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'SEQNR'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'SEQNR'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'ABKRS'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'ABKRS'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'FPPER'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'FPPER'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'INPER'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'INPER'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'PAYTY'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'PAYTY'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'PAYDT'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_tabname = 'PC261'.
  ls_fieldcat-ref_fieldname = 'PAYDT'.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'STATUS'.
  ls_fieldcat-seltext_m = 'Status'.
  ls_fieldcat-icon = abap_true.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

  CLEAR ls_fieldcat.
  ls_fieldcat-fieldname = 'DESCR'.
  ls_fieldcat-seltext_m = 'Details'.
  ls_fieldcat-outputlen = 120.
  APPEND ls_fieldcat TO lt_fieldcat.

*& Build alv layout
  ls_layout-colwidth_optimize = abap_true.
  ls_layout-zebra = abap_true.

*& Display log
  CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
    EXPORTING
      i_grid_title  = 'US_CE : Tax Company update in Payoll Results ( PCL2 )'
      is_layout     = ls_layout
      it_fieldcat   = lt_fieldcat
    TABLES
      t_outtab      = lt_log
    EXCEPTIONS
      program_error = 1
      OTHERS        = 2.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
            WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4.
  ENDIF.                               " IF sy-subrc <> 0.

entry.title: Unlock Your Business Transformation with the Integrated Toolchain
entry.content:
In early 2025, SAP unveiled the new SAP Business Suite, marking a transformative era in modern enterprise management.
By combining artificial intelligence, data, and applications, SAP Business Suite empowers organizations to unlock innovation, drive operational excellence, and create differentiated business value.

Whether you're an existing SAP ERP customer or new to SAP solutions, transitioning to the SAP Business Suite is a significant step. At SAP, we've had the privilege of guiding many customers through their transformation journeys—experience that led to the creation of a structured, repeatable framework: the RISE with SAP Methodology.

This Methodology contains three main elements:

  • The Standardized framework: A structured path based on best practices roadmaps with recommendations, guidelines, and checkpoints for each step of your journey.
  • The Integrated toolchain: Tools to enhance your productivity, accelerate your project timelines, improve quality, and promote seamless, cross-team collaboration.
  • Expert guidance: SAP and qualified partners who get you up and running with a predictable scope and implementation timeline during your entire transformation journey.

In this blog we focus on the integrated toolchain, providing the right integrated tools to support the entire migration process with greater ease and efficiency. And we’re continuously enhancing these tools—adding new capabilities and embedding AI to further accelerate and simplify your transformation.

 

Consistent data. Extended by partners. Enabled by AI.

We learned that transformation success depends on more than just a single tool to support individual steps in the journey. Furthermore, it requires:

  • Consistent data throughout the transformation project to align decisions, processes, and outcomes –
  • A rich set of integrated tools extended by partners who bring specific expertise and tools to support our customers on their transformation journey
  • AI-enabled intelligence will be omnipresent along the integrated toolchain to support customers, consultants and architects to be more productive during the transformation

All of this combines the Integrated Toolchain

 

 

Together, these principles set the foundation for a successful and effective transformation.

SAPs integrated toolchain is designed to help our customers along the transformation journey with fully connected and integrated tools.

1.     Consistent data flow throughout your journey

The RISE with SAP Methodology provides a clear, structured approach to transformation utilizing the standardized framework. The Integrated Toolchain enables and accelerates this journey from end to end — combining tools that support each critical stage with sharing data along the process.

Let’s have a look on the journey, the individual tasks and how the toolchain will help these processes. In the overview graphics you can see that the different solutions in the Toolchain are not assigned to the different phases, but they support the transformation trough the full project and exchanging data to avoid double entry or inconsistencies. But let’s start along those phases to go through the transformation project and touch every solution

 

1.1 Discover & onboard

While new customers would directly start with the Digital Discovery Assessment to match their processes and priorities with needed capabilities - existing SAP ERP customers can first start to analyze their current processes based on real data with the help of SAP Signavio. This data is then handed over to SAP LeanIX to analyze and visualize your current architecture including dependencies, identifying risks and outdated systems.  This is the basis for designing the target architecture in the next phase.

As a next step, the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA) helps define your business strategy and design the scope of the future solution by gathering customers’ requirements. Matching these requirements against Business Suite solutions proposes a list of solutions to fulfill all customers’ needs and additionally creates a customer project roadmap based on the customer’s needs. This is the basis for the customer's individual project roadmap.

1.2 Modernize & run

Based on the data of the Discover phase, SAP Lean IX helps to plan a future-ready architecture aligned with your business goals.

SAP Signavio supports designing and publishing new business process models which are then used by Cloud ALM to support implementations designing, testing and deploying the solutions. Additionally, Cloud ALM executes your roadmap using SAP Activate and best-practice content while tracking progress and managing quality with built-in checkpoints. It monitors and resolves issues proactively with analytics. This includes managing solution configuration, developing and integrating required extensions in adherence to the clean core compatible principals, based on the Business Technology Platform using no-code, low-code or pro-code as well as AI capabilities built in SAP Build. Partner solutions like SAP Test Automation by Tricentis help to design and run automated end-top-end tests to validate changes faster, increase process quality and reduce business risks. The SAP Business transformation center helps to clean and transform your business data of the former system into a AI ready data structures of the new landscape.

To maximize the adoption of new business processes, WalkMe in-app guidance and end-user training can assist to onboard and support users during a successful go-live, helping them use the new system efficiently.

1.3 Continuously innovate

After the successful go live SAP Cloud solution subscriptions include ongoing enhancements delivered through regular updates to enable continuous innovations delivering sustained business value to customers and their end-users.

The tools in the Integrated toolchain will help you shaping this process of continuous innovations:

SAP LeanIX identifies the latest architecture improvements and continuously mirrors the system architecture.

SAP Signavio updates its data to mirror the newest business processes based on the latest enhancements.

SAP Cloud ALM track progress and manage quality with built-in checkpoints and monitor and resolve issues proactively with analytics

SAP WalkMe updates its guidance data to best enable and support users based on the latest enhancements.

SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Build enable additional process enhancements needed to differentiate your business from the competition - based on continuously enhanced or new extensions, built in a clean core compatible way to maintain and secure an upgradable core.

 

Want to see the integrated toolchain in action – just watch our video:

2.     Scale with partners to augment the toolchain

The integrated toolchain is open and extensible to partners who bring specific expertise and tools to support our customers on their transformation journey. Partners can build and integrate their own specialized tools, leveraging deep expertise or industry best practices to complement the core toolset. This openness ensures that every customer transformation project can benefit from proven methodologies, tailored accelerators, and innovative partner solutions—creating a flexible ecosystem that adapts to diverse business needs.

3.     Integrated Toolchain enabled by AI

We are adding AI capabilities into our integrated toolchain to boost your transformation efficiency and reduce duration, effort, and cost of transformation significantly.

As an example, SAP Lean IX gets new capabilities based on AI:

  1. Analyze as-is: Leverage the inventory builder to quickly build your inventory based on the AI analysis of unstructured data and the generation of LeanIX fact sheets
  2. Identify improvements: Leverage AI-assisted architecture guidance for continuous recommendations on where and how to optimize your enterprise architecture, with streamlined and actionable insights

On top we are working on the new Transition Guidance - SAP’s AI enabled application which acts as your pro-active encyclopedia deployed on Cloud ALM to

  • Connect the dots across tools, services and content to further increase usability and efficiency during all three phases (Discover & onboard, Modernize & Run, and Continuous innovations).
  • Provide personalized, system-based recommendations to accelerate fact-based decisions during transformation
  • Add a dialog driven conversational expert guidance based on Joule, giving advice along many advisory categories.

Clear business value

In a nutshell, the SAP Integrated Toolchain is built to deliver clear business value in 4 key dimensions:

30% cost reduction for the transformation project.

35% faster execution of the transformation leading to faster time to value.

70% increased business agility enabling customers to react faster to new market conditions to stay ahead of the competition.

40% Faster continuous innovation to benefit from newest capabilities supporting your business earlier.

 

 

Ready to Take the Next Step?

With RISE with SAP Methodology and the Integrated Toolchain, your transformation becomes a clear, guided journey — powered by best practices, intelligent tools, and continuous support.

Learn more: www.sap.com/rise-methodology

entry.title: Re: MANAGE REPAYMENT REQUEST APP NOT FOUND
entry.content:
Hello @FabioSpulveda 

The Manage Repayment Requests app (F5754) appears in the Fiori Apps Library for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, but it is part of FI-CA Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable.

FI-CA is not part of the standard Finance scope; it is only available if scope item 5D2 – Convergent Invoicing and FI-CA  , or a related industry package, is activated. If that scope is not included in your subscription, the app will not appear.

Review scope items in Manage Your Solution, and if needed, request activation through the CBC /SAP contact.

SAP Help – Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable (FI-CA) Overview

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to send Data (Integration) from SAP Datasphere to...
entry.content:
Hello Ahmed,

You cannot connect SAP Datasphere directly to GRDC. GRDC only receives data from S/4HANA Cloud through communication scenario SAP_COM_0241 or via file uploads.

In Datasphere, to enable GRDC to access the data, you must first load it into S/4HANA Cloud, using methods such as the Journal Entry – Post API or the Group Reporting APIs. Afterwards, GRDC retrieves the data from S/4.

Alternatively, export your data from Datasphere as a CSV file and upload it into GRDC using a data collection task.

The Application Server field in Datasphere should point to your S/4HANA Cloud API URL (e.g., https://<tenant>.s4hana.cloud.sap). The disabled features in your connection setup are expected, because Datasphere → S/4 connection is designed for reading and writing via OData, not for GRDC integration.

To verify integration, review the Communication Arrangement SAP_COM_0241 in S/4 for status and logs, and execute a test package in GRDC to confirm data fetch.

Please inform me if you require any further assistance.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: MANAGE REPAYMENT REQUEST APP NOT FOUND

Dear @FabioSpulveda , 

please check the following steps: 

 

  • Check the Manage Your Solution app: In your Fiori launchpad, go to the Manage Your Solution app. Search for the scope item: Look for the Accounts Payable scope item (J60) in the list of activated business processes. If this scope item is not active, submit a request to SAP to activate it.

entry.title: Re: Manual GL Account Assignment for Billing Transactions
entry.content:
Hello @mbanggo 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, It is not possible to alter the reconciliation account when creating a supplier invoice referencing a PO or through the Create Supplier Invoice app (F0859). The reconciliation account is always obtained from the supplier master record and cannot be manually overridden.

The only case where an alternative G/L can be chosen is in direct FI postings, Post Supplier Invoice-Manage Supplier Invoices for Accounts Payable Accountant F0859  – FB60 equivalent. Since these are not subledger-managed postings.

Reference: SAP Help – Supplier Invoice Processing (Public Cloud)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Automatic addition of 1<>1 in queries when no data is returned in prompts (BO 4.3)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am using SAP BusinessObjects 4.3 Webi reports and observed the following behavior:

- My report contains multiple queries that rely on a Customer ID prompt.
- When I enter a Customer ID that has no corresponding data, in some of the queries the WHERE clause automatically gets "1<>1" appended.
- This does not happen in all queries, only in some.

I understand that this might be a mechanism to prevent unintended results, but I would like to clarify:

1. Is this behavior officially documented by SAP?
2. Is there a recommended approach to handle prompts so that "1<>1" is not automatically added?
3. Are there best practices for handling queries with potentially empty result sets in BO 4.3?

Attached are screenshots showing the SQL generated with and without data.

Thank you in advance for any guidance or insights!

entry.title: Re: SOAP API for inbound delivery updates
entry.content:
Hello @kdv3 

Batch split creation is not available in the Inbound Delivery, Read, Update (A2X) API. While the API allows updating headers and items, it does not support batch split operations.

In Public Cloud, batch splits must be managed through Fiori delivery apps or by using an extension (BAdI/BTP) after the delivery is created.

Batch Management-SAP Help 

Inbound Delivery (A2X)  

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: ASSIGN PURCHASING ORGANIZATION TO COMPANY CODE
entry.content:
Hello @jerrysam 

Yes, you can reverse the plant–purchasing organisation assignment, but it affects info records, contracts, open POs, and sourcing. Existing documents with the old assignment stay valid, while new ones follow the new mapping.

Before moving to Production, test in Q/Test.

  • Create new POs and verify sourcing and pricing.
  • Validate contracts, scheduling agreements, and vendor purchasing organisation data.
  • Run MRP to confirm sourcing functions correctly.
  • Verify the financial institution's postings and approvals.

Assigning Plant to Purchasing Organisation-SAP Help 

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Split Valuation in SAP MM
entry.content:
Prezados colegas,

Faço parte do tempo de implementação do SAP/4Hana desde janeiro de 2025 e atualmente o projeto está na terceira onda que deverá integrar todo o grupo a nível Brasil com a mesma base do SAP.

Na primeira onda optamos por realizar uma avaliação dividida para determinados tipos de materiais, a partir das instruções da consultoria contratada, e na época fomos avisados ​​que uma vez ativada essa função seria irreversível para o material.

No entanto, devido à legislação tributária brasileira, temos uma lista de códigos de origem de material. Em vários casos, um mesmo código de produto cadastrado pode variar entre as várias origens, dependendo do negócio concretizado.

A partir dessa lógica, a Requisição de Compra emitida pelas áreas Requisitantes envolve as informações dos Dados Mestres de Materiais de maneira automática. No entanto, a confirmação da origem do material ocorre somente na fase de Cotação e Negociação pela equipe de Compras .

Os códigos de origem do material vão de 0 a 9, e um mesmo produto pode variar entre vários desses códigos dependendo da origem do BP e da composição do produto.

A equipe de Compras recebe as requisições das áreas e somente após consultar o mercado definir qual fornecedor tem custos e, por fim, após aprovação das melhores condições definir o código de origem do material para emitir o Pedido de Compra .

Sabemos que  ao solicitar uma avaliação dividida no material, o campo origem do material fica travado/bloqueado para edição nas transações ME21N, ME22N, ME51N, ME52N onde a equipe de Compras utiliza para formalizar a compra de mercadorias através de Pedidos de Compras e Contratos . Desta forma, tantos pedidos de compras emitidos pela ME21N ou alterados pela ME22N, como Contratos de Fornecimento WK/MK emitidos via ME51N ou alterados via ME52N não possuem o campo de origem do material habilitado para conciliar a informação conforme negócio finalizado junto com a BP.

Com base nesse bloqueio, consultamos o SAP e verificamos que há uma Nota SAP que recomenda não editar quando há split valuation Standard ativado. Além disso, verificamos no QAS a possibilidade de reconfigurar esse campo (torná-lo editável) via SHD0, e chegamos à conclusão de que não permite reconfigurar justamente por esse Note SAP.

Queremos uma solução rápida para essa falha no processo de Aquisição, através de uma melhoria nas transações supracitadas que se adequem à legislação brasileira para atender não somente ao nosso projeto, mas para  todos os clientes SAP no Brasil. Pois o impacto negativo ao negócio é enorme e a melhoria traria flexibilidade aos usuários de Compras e maior assertividade nos negócios junto à BP, evitando retrabalhos nos dados mestres, alterações constantes em Pedidos de Compras e Contratos, atrasos nas transações de estoques e conciliações nos objetos de custos, além de riscos de atrasos de pagamentos das compras realizadas.

Estamos à disposição para testar em massa essa melhoria através do SAP/4Hana.

Fico grato pela atenção.
Rodrigo Vieira de Carvalho

entry.title: Re: Error en aplicación Nota 3613078
entry.content:
Hola Comunidad

Algunos de ustedes aplicaron la opción 2 de la nota 3613078, en mi caso particular en periodo quincenal 19.2025 aplique 3 faltas como la constante CKINF esta en cero el descuento lo hace por el total de días y eel empleado es solvente para este descuento.

En periodo 20.2025 hace recalculo a periodo 19.2025 y en periodo 20.2025 regresa lo que desconto en 19 y calcula el descuento a 16 días lo cual es correcto.

Mi duda es por que regresa /381 que descontó correctamente en periodo 19

el /381 tiene en vista V_T51P6 B 2 4 como lo sugiere la nota.

Espero y alguno de ustedes me pueda apoyar.

Saludos

entry.title: Deleting double postings after mapping data through Data Actions
entry.content:
@N1kh1l Hello all,

I load data through CSV file where Func Area and Plant = #. I have made this data action to map combinations to correct Func Area (I dont care about Plant) looking up budget data from last year. It maps correctly, however the old combinations stays there. I have tried saving the data before mapping on a variablemember and a if statement that deletes if input = temp version. However, there are sometimes a few new combinations that wasnt there last year in budget Version. I don't want to delete them. With this method, I delete them also unfortunately.

Do anyone have an idea, where I only delete the old combinations (that is still on func area = # ) that have been mapped? Or better, dont make double transactions.

@N1kh1l  ?

CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/FUNC_AREA], [d/COST_CENTER], [d/PROFIT], [d/Plant], [d/GL_ACCOUNT]

//SCOPE
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/From_Date] TO [d/Version].[p/To_Date]
MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = ("Amount_LC")

VARIABLEMEMBER #TEMP OF [d/Version] 
VARIABLEMEMBER #TEMPBUDGET OF [d/Version]

AGGREGATE_DIMENSIONS = [d/Plant]
AGGREGATE_WRITETO [d/Plant] = "#"

//DATA WRITING
DATA() = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Input", [d/FUNC_AREA] = "#")
* (RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Budget", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(12,"MONTH")) / RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Budget", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(12,"MONTH")))

entry.title: अगर किसी गलत व्यक्ति को भेज दिया जाए तो गूगल पे से पैसे वापस कैसे पाए जाते हैं?
entry.content: अगर गूगल पे (Google Pay) टोल फ्री नंबर __0923_390__8323__पर किसी गलत व्यक्ति को पैसे भेज दिए गए हैं, तो तुरंत गूगल पे ऐप में उस लेनदेन की रिपोर्ट करें, एनपीसीआई (NPCI) की ग़लत भुगतान करने के लिए शिकायत करें या सीधे अपने बैंक से संपर्क करें. आप उस व्यक्ति से भी संपर्क कर सकते हैं और पैसे वापस भेजने का अनुरोध कर सकते हैं, लेकिन यह एक भरोसेमंद तरीका नहीं है.

entry.title: Re: अगर किसी गलत व्यक्ति को भेज दिया जाए तो गूगल पे से पैसे वापस कैसे पाए जाते हैं?
entry.content: अगर गूगल पे (Google Pay) टोल फ्री नंबर __📞__पर किसी गलत व्यक्ति को पैसे भेज दिए गए हैं, तो तुरंत गूगल पे ऐप में उस लेनदेन की रिपोर्ट करें, एनपीसीआई (NPCI) की ग़लत भुगतान करने के लिए शिकायत करें या सीधे अपने बैंक से संपर्क करें. आप उस व्यक्ति से भी संपर्क कर सकते हैं और पैसे वापस भेजने का अनुरोध कर सकते हैं, लेकिन यह एक भरोसेमंद तरीका नहीं है.

entry.title: यदि एटीएम से पैसा निकालते समय बिजली चली जाए, तो क्या होगा?
entry.content: यदि एटीएम से पैसा निकालते समय बिजली चली जाए, तो क्या होगा? टोल फ्री नंबर__0923-390-8323__लेकिन बाहर नहीं आ पाता। ऐसी स्थिति में, आपको तुरंत अपने बैंक से संपर्क करना __0923__390__8323__होगा और एक शिकायत दर्ज करानी होगी। बैंक सीसीटीवी फुटेज और ट्रांजैक्शन लॉग की जांच करेगा और यदि पैसा नहीं निकला है तो 7 दिनों के अंदर आपके खाते में वापस कर दिया जाएगा।

entry.title: Re: Add the custom field I added to the sales order to th...
entry.content:
Hello @dogukanpadel 

My Inbox and workflow apps don’t allow Adapt UI, so the message is expected. To display your custom field YY1_AvansMiktar, you need to

  • Publish the field in the right business context (done).
  • Extend the workflow context via Manage Workflow Scenarios or a Custom CDS View/Data Source Extension.
  • Adjust the workflow form template so the field appears in My Inbox.

You must extend the workflow data model and form template.

Let me know how it goes

My Inbox(F0862) 

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: मीशो में शिकायत कैसे दर्ज करें?-+
entry.content: कस्टमर केयर नंबर का उपयोग करके शिपिंग के बाद मीशो पर ऑर्डर रद्द करें आप ऐप के माध्यम से मीशो पर शिप किए गए ऑर्डर को भी रद्द कर सकते हैं। शिप किए गए संदेश प्रदर्शित होने के बाद मीशो में ऑर्डर रद्द करने का तरीका इस प्रकार है: आप उनके हेल्पलाइन नंबर 91 (8984_614÷990) पर डायल कर सकते हैं।
